last_episode_to_air.name: Dinner Party: Ending on a High Note
last_episode_to_air.overview: Wiz Khalifa, Jill Scott, Shania Twain and Imagine Dragons frontman Dan Reynolds open up about inspiration, success and the emotional power of music.

name: Chelsea
overview: It's not her first talk show, but it is a first of its kind. Ideas, people and places that fascinate her, all in her unique style.

seasons.name: Season 2
seasons.overview: She's biting, she's brassy, and she's back. Host Chelsea Handler returns with season two of her convention-defying talk show, switching to an hourly, once-a-week format with new episodes each Friday.

episodes.name: Appetite for Instruction
episodes.overview: Chelsea kicks off a whole new journey of discovery and delinquency with guests Drew Barrymore, Chris Martin and the U.S. secretary of education.

episodes.name: Gwyneth & Tony & Chelsea & TED
episodes.overview: Chelsea talks lube with Gwyneth Paltrow and lobbying with Tony Hale, tests her acting chops in a telenovela, and learns the secret to an ace TED talk.

episodes.name: Dinner Party: Captain America & Friends
episodes.overview: Chris Evans and the "Civil War" cast dish on superhero culture and Hollywood's blind spots, and Chadwick Boseman schools Chelsea on Black Panther.

episodes.name: Gwen Stefani, Tokyo Style & the Night Sun
episodes.overview: Chelsea talks tour life with Gwen Stefani, steps out with a colorful Harajuku squad, and studies the moon with NASA's "Mohawk Guy," Bobak Ferdowsi.

episodes.name: Wanda Sykes & the 2016 Political Scene
episodes.overview: Chelsea delves into the U.S. presidential race with comedian Wanda Sykes, former Obama speechwriter Jon Favreau and a posse of senior Florida voters.

episodes.name: Christina Aguilera & Chelsea on Ice
episodes.overview: Chelsea reaches for a big note with the Grammy-winning "Voice" coach and steps into the rink with a pair of Russian figure skaters.

episodes.name: Barbara Boxer & Souls to the Polls
episodes.overview: Senator Boxer and African-American churchgoers break down what's at stake in the 2016 election. Snapchat guru DJ Khaled preaches the keys to success.

episodes.name: Perils of Porn & Rachel Bloom's Big Year
episodes.overview: Recovering addicts warn of porn's troubling side effects, and the "Crazy Ex-Girlfriend" star charts her journey from despair to a Golden Globe.

episodes.name: Ashton Kutcher & the App Economy
episodes.overview: The actor-turned-mogul shares investing tips and joins Cindy McCain to shed light on human trafficking. Chelsea steps out as a dog walker for hire.

episodes.name: Dinner Party: Adventures in Parenting
episodes.overview: Avowed non-parent Chelsea grills Kate Hudson and others about the appeal of raising kids and has her nails done by a gender-nonconforming 9-year-old.

episodes.name: Magic & GMOs with Lizzy Caplan, Bill Nye
episodes.overview: The Science Guy weighs in on Chelsea's cryotherapy experiment and his new thinking on GMOs. "Masters of Sex" star Lizzy Caplan performs a magic trick.

episodes.name: Election Math & Megan Fox
episodes.overview: MSNBC's Jacob Soboroff explains the fuss over superdelegates, and astrology maven Megan Fox tries to make sense of mixed signals in Chelsea's chart.

episodes.name: Warrior Dash & Will Arnett
episodes.overview: Chelsea dives into a grueling mud race, Will Arnett puts a new spin on Trump's tweets, and "Daily Show" Hasan Minhaj talks Indian toilets.

episodes.name: Summits, Thruples & David Spade
episodes.overview: Chelsea talks threesomes with the 'Do-Over' star, waits tables with her niece, and gets the inside scoop on Melissa Arnot's historic Everest feat.

episodes.name: The Case for Cannabis with Wiz Khalifa
episodes.overview: The rapper joins California Lt. Governor Gavin Newsom to push for game-changing action on pot. Chelsea tries working out stoned with an MMA fighter.

episodes.name: Cocaine Kingpins & the Science of Sleep
episodes.overview: Chelsea delves into the world of "Narcos" with star Wagner Moura and real-life DEA agent Javier Peña. Ariana Huffington warns of sleeping pill risks.

episodes.name: Ellen Page & Inspiring Role Models
episodes.overview: The actress opens up about her LGBT travel show and the devastating toll of the Orlando shooting. Also featuring Florence Henderson, Von Miller.

episodes.name: Trump Mania & Kegel Exercises
episodes.overview: Chelsea gives Mexican teens a whack at Donald Trump, while Keith Olbermann sizes up the candidate's psyche. Anna Faris and Allison Janney talk Kegels.

episodes.name: Paulson, Pelosi & Ayahuasca
episodes.overview: "People v. O.J." star Sarah Paulson praises Marcia Clark. Nancy Pelosi calls for action on guns. Jason Biggs and Jenny Mollen share wild travel tales.

episodes.name: Biker Life & Michael Strahan
episodes.overview: "Walking Dead" star Norman Reedus gives Chelsea a taste of motorcycle culture. Strahan talks flirting, good fortune and his new underwear line.

episodes.name: Devine, Bamford & Adult Coloring
episodes.overview: Comedians Adam Devine and Maria Bamford talk stand-ups, psych wards and success. Chelsea tries a mindful coloring session with Metta World Peace.

episodes.name: Anna Kendrick & Social Media Snafus
episodes.overview: The actress details a hair-raising outing in Hawaii. Comedian Jim Gaffigan responds to the backlash over his manicure tweet. Plus, modern dating tips.

episodes.name: Blake Shelton & Hillary's VP Options
episodes.overview: The country star reveals how girlfriend Gwen Stefani upstaged him on his birthday. Former congressman Barney Frank shares his ideal Democratic ticket.

episodes.name: Tarzan, Mars & Aubrey Plaza
episodes.overview: Alexander Skarsgård reveals his punishing 'Legend of Tarzan' diet, Aubrey Plaza fantasizes about freeing dolphins, and Chelsea studies the red planet.

episodes.name: Vicente Fox & All Things Mexico
episodes.overview: Chelsea sips mezcal with actor Diego Luna, gets a history lesson from Eva Longoria and grills former Mexican president Fox on bullfighting and Trump.

episodes.name: Charlize Theron & Convention Fever
episodes.overview: The 'Mad Max' star opens up about her nontraditional family and dream of stamping out HIV. Jacob Soboroff sizes up VP rumors ahead of the RNC and DNC.

episodes.name: Bill Maher & Dirty Water Polo Tricks
episodes.overview: The 'Real Time' host rips into Donald Trump, a former top cop talks police militarization, and Olympian Tony Azevedo reveals racy water polo secrets.

episodes.name: LGBTQ Life with Jane Lynch & E.J. Johnson
episodes.overview: The 'Glee' and '#RichKids' stars talk coming out, gay bars and evolving labels. A transgender woman and her partner share their transitioning story.

episodes.name: Bucking the Rules with Melissa McCarthy
episodes.overview: The actress responds to 'Ghostbusters' skeptics and flouts fashion norms with her new clothing line. Zachary Quinto celebrates a 'Star Trek' first.

episodes.name: Brexit's Aftermath & Competitive Tickling
episodes.overview: 'Suicide Squad' star Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje and chef Gordon Ramsay break down Britain's predicament. 'Tickled' lifts the lid on a surreal world.

episodes.name: Trump's Other Reality Show
episodes.overview: NeNe Leakes, Clay Aiken and fellow "Celebrity Apprentice" alums dissect the GOP nominee's appeal. Comedian Jim Jefferies poses with male strippers.

episodes.name: This Is My Home
episodes.overview: Chelsea rents her house out to a Filipino family on Airbnb, Jay Leno relives a hairy crash, and actress Gillian Jacobs shares a terror of improv.

episodes.name: Tatiana Maslany Takes All the Good Parts
episodes.overview: The 'Orphan Black' star shares the secret to playing clones. The Go-Go's reflect on 38 years of fun, fame and fistfights ahead of their farewell tour.

episodes.name: Dinner Party: The God Question
episodes.overview: Reese Witherspoon, Common and friends of different faiths open up about their spiritual journeys. Chelsea gets a crash course in religious history.

episodes.name: Chelsea Does the DNC
episodes.overview: Emotions run high as Chelsea crashes her first political convention and learns about a civil rights hero. With Jacob Soboroff and David Axelrod.

episodes.name: You Have a Speedo For Me?
episodes.overview: Jason Biggs hops into the pool with the U.S. men's Olympic water polo team. The irrepressible Denis Leary riffs on his wild past and 27-year marriage.

episodes.name: A Prodigy in Our Midst
episodes.overview: Chelsea's niece steps in as co-host, and Bryce Dallas Howard offers tips on growing up in a famous family. James Carville marvels at Trump's behavior.

episodes.name: Putting Compton Back on the Map
episodes.overview: Mayor Aja Brown fights to rebuild a city plagued by turmoil. David Axelrod offers insights on Obama. Michael Kelly talks eerie 'House of Cards' plots.

episodes.name: Mission to Moscow
episodes.overview: In the land of vodka, Chelsea braves a bracing spa ritual, tries rhythmic gymnastics with Maria Sharapova and probes the mystery of Russian men.

episodes.name: The Porn King of Japan
episodes.overview: Chelsea gets sex tips from an adult film icon, talks history with 'Ben-Hur' star Jack Huston and urges the 'American Ninja Warrior' hosts to man up.

episodes.name: Zelda Williams Defies the Trolls
episodes.overview: The actress reflects on her complex relationship with social media after the death of her father, Robin. Plus, Jon Favreau on Obama's writing habits.

episodes.name: Let's Go on My Tinder
episodes.overview: Chelsea asks Tinder CEO Sean Rad for help with her profile and heads into the wilderness for survival school. With Eric André and Joel Kinnaman.

episodes.name: For You to Get This Hostile Is Weird
episodes.overview: Sparks fly as Chelsea talks cats, fame and Obama with comedian Marc Maron and actress Natasha Lyonne. Plus, Olympic swimming champ Nathan Adrian.

episodes.name: We Have Influencers Here
episodes.overview: Kate Upton and a crew of YouTube stars discuss the life-changing power of social media. Nasty Gal's Sophia Amoruso shares her wild success story.

episodes.name: How Could People Go Off on You?
episodes.overview: Model Ashley Graham and country singer Jana Kramer bond over their brushes with public shaming. Plus, beauty pageant boot camp and comic Jimmy Carr.

episodes.name: It Felt Like Racist WrestleMania
episodes.overview: Hasan Minhaj of "The Daily Show" recounts his hair-raising trip to the RNC, and the women of "Mr. Robot" celebrate their stereotype-defying roles.

episodes.name: That's MY Tight End
episodes.overview: "New Girl" star Max Greenfield hails the joys of fantasy football, Noah Galloway discusses his post-"DWTS" breakup, and Jeff Ross roasts Ann Coulter.

episodes.name: Oh, This Isn't Funny Anymore
episodes.overview: Comedian David Cross mourns the "quaint" early stages of Trump's campaign. Chelsea and "Sully" actor Aaron Eckhart talk phobias and hypnosis.

episodes.name: Dinner Party: The State of Politics
episodes.overview: Chelsea invites a politically diverse group including W. Kamau Bell and S.E. Cupp to dissect the rise of Trump and the issues that divide Americans.

episodes.name: Flashbacks to the Good Old '80s
episodes.overview: The kids from "Stranger Things" talk sudden fame and welcome a surprise visitor. Abigail Breslin slams an offensive tweet. Plus, comedian Bob Saget.

episodes.name: The Right, Fair Thing to Do
episodes.overview: Oscar winner Patricia Arquette makes an urgent plea for equal pay, and Aisha Tyler rejects the toxic female relationships depicted on TV.

episodes.name: Sex in Space
episodes.overview: Neil deGrasse Tyson explains the hazards of zero-gravity intimacy. Michael Sheen talks "Masters of Sex." Jenny Mollen obsesses over Jason Biggs's ex.

episodes.name: I Was a Ticking Time Bomb
episodes.overview: Sarah Silverman opens up about a recent health scare and her fiery DNC remarks. Gloria Steinem talks politics and her Emmy-nominated Vice show.

episodes.name: My Story is an American Story
episodes.overview: "OITNB" actress Diane Guerrero reflects on her parents' deportation. Mike Colter shares the symbolism behind Luke Cage's hoodie. With Craig Ferguson.

episodes.name: Fame Is Just Weird to Me
episodes.overview: "Bridget Jones" star Renée Zellweger looks back on a life-changing phone call. Chris Geere recalls an awkward sex scene. Plus: Who is Alex Trebek?

episodes.name: Would You Buy Your Dad a Hooker?
episodes.overview: Amy Schumer riffs on awkward family dynamics, dating life and pressure from fans. "Shark Tank" star Mark Cuban explains his change of heart on Trump.

episodes.name: Bareback Riding Skills
episodes.overview: Chris Pratt and his "Magnificent Seven" posse talk feisty horses and behind-the-scenes bromance. Chelsea heads to the racetrack for jockey school.

episodes.name: I Was Naked on Broadway
episodes.overview: Lea Michele's tales of stripping down take even Chelsea by surprise. NBA Hall of Famer Reggie Miller salutes Colin Kaepernick. With comic T.J. Miller.

episodes.name: Boys Are Told Not to Cry
episodes.overview: "Girl on the Train" actor Edgar Ramírez rips harmful gender stereotypes. Jessica Alba shares the key to her Honest Company success. With Gavin Newsom.

episodes.name: When Ann Coulter Calls in Sick
episodes.overview: Chelsea taps the conservative pundit's "body double" for a biting interview. Kristen Bell finds a cure for online gloom and doom. With Jacob Soboroff.

episodes.name: Climate Change Is Here and It's Real
episodes.overview: Don Cheadle, Joshua Jackson, Ed Begley Jr. and the U.S. secretary of energy delve into the dangers we're facing and steps everyone can take to help.

episodes.name: I Love a Good Mean Joke
episodes.overview: Rob Lowe dishes on his brutal Comedy Central roast and life as a Hollywood heartthrob. With comedians Nick Kroll, John Mulaney and Russell Peters.

episodes.name: It's Girl Empowerment
episodes.overview: Krysten Ritter hails the cliché-crushing power of Jessica Jones. Rumer Willis pushes back on doctored photos. Plus, the inside story of "Amanda Knox."

episodes.name: Do You Know How to Use the Car?
episodes.overview: Chelsea's bid to become a Lyft driver turns tense when she takes her mentor on a hair-raising ride. With Taylor Lautner and the Property Brothers.

episodes.name: So Let's Take a Test
episodes.overview: Education Secretary John King quizzes Chelsea on geography and more. Glennon Doyle Melton calls out toxic messages to girls. Plus, Jennifer Connelly.

episodes.name: I Don't Want to Mess Up Again
episodes.overview: Comedian Kevin Hart talks fame, marriage and the mistakes of his past. Jesse Ventura slams the "rigged" election. Larry King moderates a mock debate.

episodes.name: Dinner Party: These Strong Women
episodes.overview: Chelsea sits down with Hilary Swank, Ava DuVernay, Connie Britton and the reigning Miss USA to talk ambition, sexuality, burning injustices and more.

episodes.name: That's When Madea Was Born
episodes.overview: Tyler Perry reflects on a wild twist of fate, his foray into fatherhood and buying an Army base. With Cobie Smulders and Vice's Alyssa Mastromonaco.

episodes.name: I'm Here to Volunteer
episodes.overview: Jason Biggs and Jenny Mollen go to work for Team Clinton. Journalist Jorge Ramos warns of a rising tide of hatred. With Isla Fisher and Thomas Lennon.

episodes.name: Whoa, I'm a Pop Star
episodes.overview: Grammy winner Meghan Trainor dishes on her new beau, her creative process and more. Plus, Priyanka Chopra and transgender Senate hopeful Misty Snow.

episodes.name: I Feel Like I'm In a Fellini Film
episodes.overview: Felicity Jones and Ron Howard talk "Inferno," awkward auditions and the closely guarded secrets of "Rogue One." Norah Jones hits the stage to perform.

episodes.name: It Tears You Down, and Builds You
episodes.overview: Shannen Doherty offers a raw glimpse of how cancer has redefined her self-image, upended long relationships and changed her life -- for the better.

episodes.name: How Dark My Life Once Was
episodes.overview: Nicole Richie opens up about her transformation from rebellious youth to poised mom and women's advocate. Plus, "Moonlight" star Trevante Rhodes.

episodes.name: So Fiercely Proud of My Mom
episodes.overview: Chelsea Clinton speaks out about her mother's resilience, the high stakes in this election, and an "offensive" ploy by Trump. With Rose McGowan.

episodes.name: Please Take My Knickers Off
episodes.overview: Stella and Mary McCartney talk fashion, royalty and sisterhood. Craig Ferguson offers a primer on Scotland. Plus, Colleen Ballinger and Kimbal Musk.

episodes.name: They Said It's a Man's Game
episodes.overview: Comedy legend Carol Burnett shares the joys and hazards of hosting her own variety show in the 1960s. With Rob Corddry and ESPN's Jessica Mendoza.

episodes.name: Do Not Despair About Our Country
episodes.overview: Chelsea sifts through the dizzying emotional and political fallout of the election with help from Sen. Barbara Boxer, Mary McCormack and Nikki Glaser.

episodes.name: Dinner Party: The Best Relationships
episodes.overview: Sarah Jessica Parker, Morgan Spurlock, Trevor Noah and Julianna Margulies talk friends, parenting, work and the bonds that have shaped their lives.

episodes.name: Inside the Trump Tower Bubble
episodes.overview: Jake Tapper weighs in on Donald Trump's shifting positions, Maria Shriver critiques Chelsea's interviewing style, and Matt LeBlanc talks "Top Gear."

episodes.name: You Secretly Hope You're Worthy
episodes.overview: Emmy Rossum recounts a bold career move, Obama adviser Valerie Jarrett looks back on the president's big wins, and Flula explores the world of D&D.

episodes.name: You're Basically a Piece of Meat
episodes.overview: Chelsea grills Milo Ventimiglia on the "Gilmore Girls" revival and his "This Is Us" physique. Kyra Sedgwick reflects on her 28-year marriage.

episodes.name: First Train to Tokyo
episodes.overview: Chelsea heads to Japan to play drinking games with geishas, visit cat cafés and crying clinics, and interrogate the locals on dating, sex and more.

episodes.name: We Cannot Go Back to Sleep
episodes.overview: Sally Field offers a defiant response to Trump's victory. Jacob Soboroff explains the recount process. Plus, Jason Biggs and a tribute to Mrs. Brady.

episodes.name: You Need to Be More Sexual
episodes.overview: Jessica Chastain shares her grandmother's saucy advice, Chelsea makes a bet with Dale Earnhardt Jr., and Van Jones rebukes Democrats and Republicans.

episodes.name: Dinner Party: Going to Prison
episodes.overview: Stars of "Orange Is the New Black" reflect on how the show has changed their lives -- and the world. Four women share their real-life prison stories.

episodes.name: Let's Talk Pipeline
episodes.overview: Susan Sarandon breaks down the dramatic Dakota pipeline standoff and the #BankExit push. Gael García Bernal extols the pleasures of mezcal and Venice.

episodes.name: The Really Uncoordinated Superhero
episodes.overview: Jennifer Aniston talks "Office Christmas Party" and her ideal superhero role. Fetty Wap explains his stance on guns. Chelsea gets high with her staff.

episodes.name: Both Naughty and Nice
episodes.overview: Kate Hudson recalls a magical holiday, LA Mayor Eric Garcetti shares his plea to Donald Trump, and Cameron Dallas and friends talk social media fame.

episodes.name: We Got to See a Beacon of Light
episodes.overview: Common looks back on Obama's impact, country star Maren Morris marvels at her wild year, and journalist Lauren Duca dissects lies by Trump.

episodes.name: Can You Tell I'm a Nightmare?
episodes.overview: In the season finale, Oscar winner Jennifer Lawrence gets punchy, Chris Hardwick talks zombies, and Chelsea revisits favorite moments from the show.

episodes.name: I Had No Backup Plan Whatsoever
episodes.overview: Melissa McCarthy and Chelsea recall the rocky road to show biz success. Van Jones slams Trump's recklessness and nepotism. With the "Nobodies" cast.

episodes.name: Women That Are Strong Are Fun
episodes.overview: Chelsea talks resilient women with Charlize Theron, civic engagement with Rep. Linda Sánchez and "the French Donald Trump" with voters in Paris.

episodes.name: Ladies and the Trump
episodes.overview: Tracee Ellis Ross, Aisha Tyler and Rosario Dawson join Chelsea to scorch Trump's first 100 days in office. Sen. Cory Booker urges political integrity.

episodes.name: Dinner Party: Getting Schooled
episodes.overview: Jim Parsons, Rashida Jones, Gaby Hoffmann and Mary McCormack celebrate teachers who impacted their lives. With former Education Secretary John King.

episodes.name: Answer Me This
episodes.overview: Chelsea quizzes “Guardians of the Galaxy” star Chris Pratt. Amy Schumer, Goldie Hawn and Wanda Sykes play a guessing game. Plus, Rep. Adam Schiff.

episodes.name: Scientologists and Pirates and Aliens, Oh My
episodes.overview: Leah Remini dissects the perils of leaving Scientology, Geoffrey Rush talks Einstein and acting with monkeys, and Danny McBride riffs on movie aliens.

episodes.name: Beauty Pageants, Black-ish and Going Broke
episodes.overview: Priyanka Chopra discusses "Baywatch" and self-esteem. Anthony Anderson reflects on racial identity. Sen. Elizabeth Warren champions higher wages.

episodes.name: Changing the Climate
episodes.overview: Sen. Al Franken brings his humor to Congress. Sarah Silverman stands up for women's health issues. Plus, Thomas Middleditch on global warming.

episodes.name: To England With Love
episodes.overview: Chelsea gives English etiquette a whirl, goes boating with Eddie Izzard, scrums with a pro rugby team and hits the pub to gauge opinions about Brexit.

episodes.name: Tear Down These Walls
episodes.overview: Salma Hayek Pinault talks massage and marriage. CNN's Don Lemon discusses truth in journalism. Jerrod Carmichael gets real about the N-word.

episodes.name: A Handler-maid's Tale
episodes.overview: Alison Brie and Betty Gilpin dish on wrestling training for "GLOW." Elisabeth Moss ponders real-life echoes of "The Handmaid's Tale." With Janet Mock.

episodes.name: Dinner Party: Good Sports
episodes.overview: NFL stars Russell Wilson and Kurt Warner, gymnast Aly Raisman and boxer Laila Ali reflect on competing, performance nerves and reinventing themselves.

episodes.name: When Chelsea Met Harry
episodes.overview: Chelsea quizzes Harry Styles, chats with singer Rita Ora and talks "Game of Thrones" sexual taboos with John Bradley. With "Pod Save America" hosts.

episodes.name: The Future Is Now
episodes.overview: Actress Cara Delevingne works to empower girls, tech leaders weigh in on cutting-edge automation, and Garbiñe Muguruza savors her big Wimbledon win.

episodes.name: Let's Keep Moving Forward
episodes.overview: Kate Beckinsale, Jill Soloway and Niecy Nash extol diversity in showbiz. Congressmen Ted Lieu and Eric Swalwell discuss immigration and impeachment.

episodes.name: Dear India
episodes.overview: Chelsea discusses Indian culture with actress Freida Pinto, haggles in a Mumbai market with Vikas Khanna, meets a guru and shakes it Bollywood-style.

episodes.name: We Are All Sharks
episodes.overview: Reese Witherspoon talks about her new movie and becoming a producer. Kathy Bates discusses "Disjointed" and medical marijuana. With Dan Rather.

episodes.name: Comfortably Naked
episodes.overview: James Corden chats musicals and public nudity, Bella Thorne hopes to inspire the next generation, and Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand addresses gun violence.

episodes.name: Handler and High Water
episodes.overview: Jessica Biel gets real about motherhood. Chelsea kayaks with Abbi Jacobson and Ilana Glazer. With S.E. Cupp, Evan McMullin and Andrea Savage.

guest_stars.character: Stephen Miller and General John Kelly
guest_stars.name: Ethan Jones

episodes.name: Game Changers
episodes.overview: Emma Stone and Billie Jean King talk “Battle of the Sexes.” Justin Hartley reflects on his Hollywood success. Plus, grassroots politician Randy Bryce.

episodes.name: The Art of the Kneel
episodes.overview: The NFL's Reggie Bush and activist DeRay Mckesson discuss athletes' defiant response to Trump. Maggie Gyllenhaal talks "The Deuce." Plus, Macklemore.

episodes.name: Hart of the Matter
episodes.overview: Kevin Hart and the Plastic Cup Boyz joke about comedy. Activists Kris Brown and Igor Volsky voice an urgent plea for gun control. Jackie Chan sings.

episodes.name: Showing Up Matters
episodes.overview: Dennis Quaid steps up for hurricane relief, Nancy Pelosi extols women's surging political clout, and Chrissy Metz mulls the impact of "This Is Us."

episodes.name: Dinner Party: My American Experience
episodes.overview: Jennifer Garner, Rob Riggle, Regina King, Mary McCormack and Dan Savage discuss their roots, patriotism, religion and modem America's complexities.

episodes.name: Gwen We Meet Again
episodes.overview: Gwen Stefani shares her love of Christmas music. Justice Bridget McCormack and activist Jason Kander talk the U.S. court system and voter suppression.

episodes.name: Making a Big Bang
episodes.overview: Chelsea talks precocious kids with Jim Parsons, quizzes Will Ferrell and Mark Wahlberg and gets some down-and-dirty workplace sensitivity training.

episodes.name: Singing, Storms and Stoned Spelling
episodes.overview: Lea Michele chats stage fright, karaoke and turkey. CNN's Bill Weir details the plight of post-hurricane Puerto Rico. Plus, a baked spelling bee.

episodes.name: Dinner Party: Scandalous
episodes.overview: Kerry Washington and her "Scandal" co-stars talk sexual harassment and real-life political bombshells. A pro fixer shares the secrets of good spin.

episodes.name: We All Have to Fight and Be Loud
episodes.overview: Former senator Barbara Boxer hails women's growing political clout. Journalist Ronan Farrow digs into the toxic consequences of sexual assault.

episodes.name: Dinner Party: Ending on a High Note
episodes.overview: Wiz Khalifa, Jill Scott, Shania Twain and Imagine Dragons frontman Dan Reynolds open up about inspiration, success and the emotional power of music.

2.name: Season 2
2.overview: She's biting, she's brassy, and she's back. Host Chelsea Handler returns with season two of her convention-defying talk show, switching to an hourly, once-a-week format with new episodes each Friday.
